```
py-cclib@1.5  py-nose@1.3.7  py-numpy@1.11.0  py-setuptools@20.7.0

==> None activated.
```

but now when I try to activate

```
$ spack activate py-cclib
==> Error: Can only (de)activate extensions for installed packages.
$ spack activate py-numpy
==> Error: Can only (de)activate extensions for installed packages.
```

which looks like a bug somewhere.

Something must be wrong with `arch=linux-None-x86_64`. Interestingly enough everything is installed in `opt/spack/linux-Ubuntu16-x86_64`. Also `compilers.yaml` identifies OS correctly as `operating_system: Ubuntu16`. Maybe that's the reason for the problem.
title: can't activate installed python packages (Ubuntu16 is identified as None)
